avalancheActivity.comment: A size 2 avalanche fell in Eldborgargil in Bláfjöll on the 26.03 during E winds with snowdrift. Hikers also triggered two smaller slabs in the same area. Small avalanches are widely seen where snow has drifted.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of snow has drifted into western aspects in the mountains for the last days. Unstable wind slabs and cornices are widespread. Natural avalanches have been falling on this layer of drift snow and avalanches can easily be triggered by skiers or hikers in the area.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs have formed widely in W aspects after E snowfall last week and ongoing E winds last days. A lot of snow has drifted and formed thick slabs that can easily be triggered by skiers or hikers. Older snowpack is widely frozen and stiff but faceting was discovered in a weak layer in snowpits on the 26th of March. High load is required in order to trigger an avalanche on this layer.

travelAdvisory.comment: Heavy snowdrift in strong NE-winds many places the last days and alot of snow added at higher elevations in the Eastfjords and invalley in the northern part. Above Flateyri four avalanches were detected this morning in the NE-winds and in the north slabs have been released by skiers in S and SW-faces in Dalsmynni and Kaldbakur above Grenivík. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills and wind slabs.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift in NE-winds. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack widely and slabs have released by skiers and naturally

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar austlægar áttir og úrkomulaust næstu daga en möguleiki á lítilsháttar éljabökkum á sunnudag. Dægursveiflur á hita þar sem frostmark gæti náð hátt til fjalla á daginn.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches fell in the region after N-NE blizzard last week. Four avalanches above Flateyri on Friday and Saturday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs in SE - NW aspects have grown considerably and are still considered unstable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Last week, a lot of snow fell in two consecutive NE blizzards. Unstable layererd wind slabs have widely formed. NE winds have continued this week with snowdrift. Snow pits from the region confirm the presence of unstable wind slabs with stiff melt-freeze snow beneath. Weak layers have been detected within new wind drifted snow and older rounded snow from last weeks blizzard. The wind slabs in SE - NW aspects have grown considerably and are still considered unstable. People should avoid steep terrain while the snowpack is still adjusting.

travelAdvisory.comment: Heavy snowdrift in strong NE-winds many places the last days and alot of snow added at higher elevations in the Eastfjords and invalley in the northern part. Above Flateyri four avalanches were detected this morning in the NE-winds and in the north slabs have been released by skiers in S and SW-faces in Dalsmynni and Kaldbakur above Grenivík. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills and wind slabs.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift in NE-winds. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack widely and slabs have released by skiers and naturally

weatherForecast.highlights: Viðvarandi NA 10-15 m/sek til fjalla með snjókomu til fjalla yfir helgina.

avalancheActivity.comment: A large avalanche in Héðinsfjörður was remotely trigger by snowmobiles on March 26th. Many slabs released in strong N-winds a week ago, some of them were big
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow inland in strong NE-winds last days, windslabs in most aspects. A large avalanche remotely triggered in Héðinsfjörður on 26th March, indicates a PWL

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of new snow in the mountains after northerly blizzard a week ago resulting in many slab avalanches some were quite big. Snowpit (Illviðrishnjúkur 26.03) showed new snow and windslab on old crust. Bond between new and old snow was rather weak with CT12. Two other snowpits from last few days showed a rather weak bond between windslab and old snow, with faceted snow and depth hoar between layers.

travelAdvisory.comment: Heavy snowdrift in strong NE-winds many places the last days and alot of snow added at higher elevations in the Eastfjords and invalley in the northern part. Above Flateyri four avalanches were detected this morning in the NE-winds and in the north slabs have been released by skiers in S and SW-faces in Dalsmynni and Kaldbakur above Grenivík. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills and wind slabs.

weatherForecast.highlights: Minnkandi SV-átt en snýst í A-læga átt með slyddu eða rigningu við sjávarmál á miðvikudagskvöld. Vindur snýst svo áfram í NA og svo N-átt á fim. með kólnandi veðri og vaxandi úrkomu um kvöldið

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches were seen yesterday. Quite a few avalanches occurred last week, one triggered by snowmobiles.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Alot of new snow in the mountains the last two days. Unstable windslabs could be present, especially on southerly aspects. Little snow is at lower elevations in the southern part.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Alot of new snow in the mountains, especially in the northern part of the area. Wind slabs are present after snowfall in N-winds a week ago and NE-winds the last two days. The snowpack is likely layered in most places and pwl expected. Little snow is at lower elevations after periods of thaw, especially in S-Eastfjords.

travelAdvisory.comment: Heavy snowdrift in strong NE-winds many places the last days and alot of snow added at higher elevations in the Eastfjords and invalley in the northern part. Above Flateyri four avalanches were detected this morning in the NE-winds and in the north slabs have been released by skiers in S and SW-faces in Dalsmynni and Kaldbakur above Grenivík. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills and wind slabs.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift in NE-winds. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack widely and slabs have released by skiers and naturally

weatherForecast.highlights: N-læga átt með einhverjum éljum fram á þriðjud.
